content.description: Climbs the corner out a roof on the right side of the face. Protection is ok, there's definitely some funk. Big adventure packed into a single pitch, trad climbing typical of the area.
content.protection: Wires up to #3 Camalot. Fixed anchor with chains on top.
content.location: Right side of the face, the obvious corner/roof. Scramble up ledges from base of sport climbs to a ledge belay.

content.description: This route has steeper face climbing on the right side of The Shield. Its difficulty seems to be dependent on the path taken through the crux, following the bolts directly is harder. It is a nice route with a rest at the midway anchors before the crux, it's 11- to there.
content.location:
The route shares start with

Blood of a Dead Hero

, then branches out right and up the steepest, cleanest part of the face.

content.description:
Sustained face climbing up the center of the face. Mostly good rock.  Steep and sporty going to the top anchors. Shares midway anchors with

Blood of a Dead Hero

.
content.protection: Bolts. This along with the other climbs nearby can be supplemented with small gear.
content.location: Climbs grey rock up the middle of the face. Look for a hanging 'tooth' 40 feet up.

content.description: There are anchors about 80 feet up the wall that you can rap from, or skip the anchors and continue climbing the heady second section to the anchors at the top of the rock. From there, rap to the midway anchors then rap down. I'm not sure, but to be safe use a 60m rope.
content.protection: Well bolted, anchors w/ chains 80 feet up and again at the top. 10-11 draws if only going to the first anchors. About 15 if climbing to the top.
content.location: This route is second to the right of the first fully bolted route. It's most distinguishable by the black stain on the face.

content.description: Starts in white rock at the left side of the wall, then follows a slanting crack to a small roof. Above the roof some face climbing leads to some blocks. The anchors are just above. Near the top there is a rather large, suspended, loose block held to the wall by forces unknown. Otherwise it's a good route.
content.protection: A few small cams, a hand size cam, stoppers. 2 bolts and an old pin. Bolted anchors with rap chains.
content.location: Left side of wall. Can be found by looking for a bolt at the lip of a small roof in white rock, 30' up. Rap from chains.

content.description: Face climbing up the left/center area of the shield.  It's 9+ to the midway anchors. Some loose rock, mostly at the top before the anchors. Great warm-up.
content.protection: Bolts, a #0.75 or #1 BD Camalot protects the move above the midway anchors.
content.location: Center of the face, the lefthand route.
